sentences.en: "I very much regret the injuries he sustained," he said.
sentences.cn: “我对他的受伤感到很遗憾，”他说。

sentences.en: a period of sustained economic development
a sustained attack on the government
Bats are the only mammals to have wings and to achieve sustained flight.
sentences.cn: 蝙蝠是唯一的有翅膀且能持续飞行的哺乳动物.

sentences.en: He appeared embarrassed and ill at ease with the sustained applause that greeted him.
sentences.cn: 向他致意的掌声一直不歇，他显得有些难为情，不知如何是好。

sentences.en: He had sustained a cut on his left eyebrow.
sentences.cn: 他左眼眉上留下了一道疤。

sentences.en: He sustained an injury to his spine when he fell off his horse.
sentences.cn: 他从马上摔下来,伤了脊梁骨.

sentences.en: He sustained serious neck injuries after he broke someone's fall.
sentences.cn: 有人坠落压在他身上，致使他颈部受重伤。

sentences.en: How such extensive damage could have been sustained so quickly remains unexplained.
sentences.cn: 如何这么快就造成这么大的破坏依然不得而知。

sentences.en: I've never done any sustained writing, but that might be one of my next directions.
sentences.cn: 我以前从未尝试过持续写作，不过那可能是我下一步努力的方向之一。

sentences.en: Sustained by this wonderful breakfast, it was with restored morale that we re-boarded our plane.
sentences.cn: 这顿丰盛的早餐补充了我们的体力，我们又精神焕发地登上了飞机。

sentences.en: The clapping was sustained for several minutes.
The parameters within which life can be sustained on Earth are extraordinarily narrow.
sentences.cn: 地球上生命可以存活下来的地域范围是非常狭小的。

sentences.en: The ship sustained damage to her bottom.

words.tran_cn: 可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的
持续性；永续性；能维持性
支持者，维持者；主发动机；支撑的人物
维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实
持续的；持久的；持久不变的
维持（sustain的过去式和过去分词）；承受

trans.tran_cn: 维持( sustain的过去式和过去分词 )，支撑，忍受，长期保持
